result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Franklin Vice was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess GHB,GB,BDO, Ketamine, Flunitraz., a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(f).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to sign up for Probation.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: $678.00 in Restitution to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF44.
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF44.
Not to use or possess firearms.
Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation within 30 days, if requested by Agent.

-Cooperate with any correctional program, evaluation or assessment as directed by Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:   Amber L Hahn   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Michael Franklin Vice appeared from jail. Case called at 2:42 pm. There is an agreement. ADA Hahn recites agreement. Moves to amend to 961.41(3g)(f). No objection from Atty Caton. Court reviews constitutional rights with Def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for amended Count One, Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def amended Guilty of Count 1. Sentencing Arguments. Court orders: 
3 years Probation W/H
- 10 months Jail condition time, 6 months STAYED. Defendant is entitled to 61 Days credit under 973.155. 
- Restition of $678.00
- Court Costs
- AODA within 30 Days
- Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation within 30 days, if requested by Agent
- Cooperate with any coorection program, evaluation or assessment as directed by Agent.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to possess a firearm
- Subject to Random UA's and PBT's
- To sign up for probation
- Follow all rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
Status conference on September 23, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
